item.title: Broadcast on 09-Oct-2014
item.description:
Big milestone : China officially surpasses the U.S as the world's largest economy. Landslide Lauren and Grahame discuss what this and other shifts in the global economic landscape could signal. PLUS, BP found guilty of misconduct. Canadian Mining Operation (Goldcorp) shutdown in Chile. Anti-Islamic ads coming to New York transit system.. and more!

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Oct-2014
item.description:
Landslide Lauren hosts a discussion with special guests: Andrea Vasquez and Simon Child, members of the UBC/SFU mining justice initiative Stop the Institute, that questions the validity and ethics of UBC's new mining institute , the CIIEID. Listen to this in-depth conversation spanning Canada's reputation, role, and actions abroad as a mining giant, the ideologies that inform this growth, and how we can transgress the polarized debate surrounding it.

item.title: Broadcast on 06-Mar-2014
item.description:
Landslide Lauren tells you all about her foray into CiTR broadcasting, why she loves the station and why you should help! CiTR: your COUNTER-STREAM... let's make like salmon and fight for our survival! In the second hour, scary proposed anti-democratic voter legislation.. here in Canada. Canadian Centre for Policy Alternatives .... why we love taxes! Maude Barlow's new book: Blue Future. item.description:
Guns & Butter" investigates the relationships among capitalism, militarism and politics. Maintaining a radical perspective in the aftermath of the September 11th attacks, "Guns & Butter: The Economics of Politics" reports on who wins and who loses when the economic resources of civil society are diverted toward global corporatization, war, and the furtherance of a national security state.
Produced and hosted by Bonnie Faulkner.
"Al Qaeda and the Global War on Terrorism" with Michel Chossudovsky. The broad consequences of 9/11 with regard to US military doctrine, and more broadly the pretext and justification which the lies surrounding 9/11 have given to waging a war of conquest under the banner of what we call the Global War on Terrorism; Libya, Syria; Q and A. November 30, 2011 - 1:00pm

item.description:
HIGH CONTRAST CONFIDENTIAL The essential tracks and remixes 2001-2009
Successor to The Chemical Brothers, Basement Jaxx and Underworld, High Contrast is another exceptional British dance music artist conquering the world's dancefloors. Making his debut way back in 2001, he's come a long way, and now we are delighted to announce the release of a stunning compilation of his best works to date.
Already hitting the top 70 in the UK album charts and all over the upper echelons of the iTunes chart, if you've slept on this it's time to catch up fast! The bumper 2 disc selection is chocked full of heavy hitting anthems from his first 3 albums, while on the second disc a master class in remixing sees the Contrast lend his sonic wizardry to everyone from Adele to Omni Trio.

item.description:
V snares Venetian Snares is the main performing alias of Canadian electronic musician Aaron Funk (born January 11, 1975). PLUS A CAST OF MANY INCLUDING FRANK ZAPPA STAR WAR'S SAUL WILLIAMS From Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, Funk is known for making electronic music often in odd numbered time signatures (mostly 7/4). He is an unusually prolific artist, having released records on the History of the Future, Isolate/DySLeXiC ResPonSe, Addict, Zod, Distort, Sublight, Low-Res, Planet Mu and Hymen record labels.
Funk debuted on a record label in 1999 with the 12" vinyl EP, Greg Hates Car Culture. Prior to this, he self-released material on cassette tape as early as 1992.[1]

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Dec-2008
item.description:
Carbon trading is a scam.
A big red flag is that our bailout buddies over at Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley, Citigroup and the other Wall Street pirates are buying heavily into carbon trading. Since these firms contributed so heavily to Obamas campaign, they will exert enormous pressure on Obama to push a huge carbon trading program. As University of Maryland professor economics professor and former Chief Economist at the U.S. International Trade Commission Peter Morici writes:
Obama must ensure that the banks use the trillions of dollars in federal bailout assistance to renegotiate mortgages and make new loans to worthy homebuyers and businesses. Obama must make certain that banks do not continue to squander federal largess by padding executive bonuses, acquiring other banks and pursuing new high-return, high-risk lines of businesses in merger activity, carbon trading and complex derivatives. Industry leaders like Citigroup have announced plans to move in those directions. Many of these bankers enjoyed influence in and contributed generously to the Obama campaign. Now it remains to be seen if a President Obama can stand up to these same bankers and persuade or compel them to act responsibly.
Thats right. The same companies that made billions off of derivatives and other scams and are now getting bailed out on your dime are going to make billions from carbon trading.
Moreover, even based on its stated goal of reducing carbon emissions, carbon trading might not work.
item.itunes:subtitle: global scamming con
